name: Easy In The Shadow of Two Gunmen 1 & 2 Trivia Quiz | Television | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
Toby.

	After the shooting, Toby was looking for Josh. He found him sitting behind a column holding his bleeding chest. Toby called out for medical help and both CJ and Sam came running.

questions.text: Ron Butterfield was shot in the hand.
questions.explanation:
True.

	President Bartlet: "This guy's probably got seven broken bones in his hand so you might want to get him an Aspirin or something."

questions.text: Who fell in the pool after being fired from her job?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	"Avert your eyes." CJ told Toby as she struggled to get out of the pool. Toby went to get her per Leo's request so she could join the Bartlet Campaign as press secretary.

questions.text: Did Sam go with Josh after he came back from seeing Governor Bartlet speak in New Hampshire?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	A dripping wet Josh grinned at Sam while he was in a meeting. Sam got up, Josh opened the door and waved at the group as they left the office.

questions.text: Dr. Lee, the anesthesiologist, was number _____ to find out about the President's condition.
According to Josh, who did Donna say assigned her?
questions.explanation:
Margaret.

	Josh couldn't even remember Donna's name at first, but after she made a good case for herself he kept her along and he has stated that she has 'enormous value to me'.

questions.text: During the shooting, who pushed CJ down behind a police car?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	This was a question that was heavily discussed at one 'The West Wing' website. However, it was Sam that pushed CJ to the ground just as a bullet shattered a police window. Sam didn't want CJ to know it was him because he didn't want her to feel beholden to him like an episode of 'I Dream of Jeanie'.

questions.text: Who did Leo find out can sign the President's name on a document?
questions.explanation:
Margaret.

	Margaret: "I have his signature pretty good."

questions.text: Who told Josh that his father died?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Donna came in while they were celebrating winning the Illinois primary. Josh wanted her to celebrate with him and she told him that his father had passed away.

questions.text: Who asked Josh if he could go with him to Connecticut for his father's funeral?
questions.explanation:
Governor Bartlet.

	Governor Bartlet: "Maybe you want some company on the plane? I can get a ticket to go with you."

questions.text: Who said, "Don't mess with us tonight"?
questions.explanation:
Leo.

	This was Leo's response when asked what message should be sent to Iraq.

questions.text: The target of the shooting was Zoey.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Charlie was the true target of the shooting. He was targeted by members of the West Virginia White Pride. The President called Charlie into his hospital room and told him.

questions.text: Toby and Leo were the only original members of the Bartlet Campaign not fired?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Jed later told Leo that Toby was the only one he didn't know.

questions.text: Besides Josh, President Bartlet and Ron, how many other people did CJ name that were shot at Rosslyn?
questions.explanation:
1.

	CJ mentions to the press that a woman named Stephanie Abbot was shot in the leg at Rosslyn. The shooters were not named in this speech.

questions.text: When Josh woke up from surgery, what did he ask President Bartlet?
questions.explanation:
"What's next?".

	Leo and the President were with Josh in the recovery room when he woke up. This episode was submitted for Bradley Whitford's 2001 Emmy win.
